citation.article-title: Methanomicrococcus blatticola gen. nov., sp. nov., a methanol- and methylamine-reducing methanogen from the hindgut of the cockroach Periplaneta americana.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Methanomicrococcus (Me.tha.no.mi'cro.coc.cus. N.L. n. methanum methane; Gr. adj. micros small; M.L. n. coccus a sphere; M.L. n. methanomicrococcus a small methane-forming sphere)
Methanomicrococcus cells are irregular methane-forming cocci with a mean diameter of 0.8 Î¼m, occurring singly or in clusters.
Susceptible to hyposmotic lysis, also during Gram-staining.
Reduce methanol with molecular hydrogen, but not hydrogen plus CO2 or methanol alone.
Tryptic soy broth, yeast extract and acetate are required for growth.
The type species is Methanomicrococcus blatticola sp. nov.
